httpserver

Class HTTPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • httpserver.HTTPServer

  • public class HTTPServer
extends java.lang.Object
    HTTPServer is a relatively simple class with one job, and one job only: wait for incoming connections, and send the connections over to an HTTPRequest and an HTTPResponse. An HTTPServer is not required to use the rest of the httpserver classes, and might not be the best base server for one to use. It exists solely to provide an existing mechanism for using the rest of the httpserver package.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Tell the server to run.

        Unless you specify the port with HTTPServer#setSocket(), the server will run on http://127.0.0.1:8000.

      • setRouter

        public void setRouter(HTTPRouter router)
        Set the HTTPRouter to determine the what HTTPHandler will be used.
        Parameters:
        router - The HTTPRouter to be used to figure out what kind of HTTPHandler we're going to use...

      • setServerInfo

        public static void setServerInfo(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String version,
                 java.lang.String etc)
        Set information about the server that will be sent through the server header to the client in this format:

        {name} v{version} ({etc})

        Parameters:
        name - The name of your server
        version - The version of your server
        etc - A message about your server
